In the following morning, you find distinctive tropical fruit the likes of which you haven’t seen throughout your trip. Dragon fruit and mangosteen, jackfruit and guava decorate the dining room. The lingering sweetness of orange coconut overtakes the air. On the beach, local fishermen drag their canoes beneath the shade to replace the wooden fixtures or repaint the borders. The charm of the coastline offers a pristine panorama, and the memories of the mountains provide a reminder of the island’s enchanting landscape. Your private transfer meets you at the hotel after breakfast and leads you to Ngurah Rai International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Rejuvenating Tropical Getaway Vacation to Bali
placesVisited: Nusa Dua, Ubud, Gili Islands, Bali Island
generalInfo: Discover how the past has shaped contemporary culture during your 8-day Bali getaway tour. An ancient spring will feed spiritual bathing pools and temple walls will turn to silhouettes at sunset. Embrace the unique and delicate intricacies of time on white sandy beaches and volcanic peaks from which the island sprang. With tiered ridges of iconic rice terraces and refreshing coffee estates, your rejuvenating getaway will cultivate Bali’s timeless joys.

dayInfo.title: Nusa Dua – Arrive in the Beauty of Bali
dayInfo.description: Bali is an island of mystique and charm, beauty, and passion. White sand beaches glow next to rich colored waters as jungle canopies don blossoming orchids and oleanders. Your flight will arrive at Ngurah Rai International Airport where you will be met by your private transfer. Your accommodation will stand at the edge of the shoreline giving you stunning views of the Indian Ocean. The remainder of the day is at your leisure giving you time to visit Puja Mandala, a unique complex that is dedicated to the five main religions of Indonesia.

dayInfo.title: Nusa Dua – Discover Tanah Lot and Uluwatu Temples
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the scent of banana pancakes may blend with the aroma of roasted coffee. Your guide will meet you in your hotel lobby and escort you to Tanah Lot temple. The edifice was built atop a stunning boulder rising out of the Indian Ocean. The nearby royal temple of Mengwi, which was constructed in the 17th century. The beautiful regal architecture rises above reflective moats, making the shrines appear as though they float on the water. At Uluwatu, you can find the traditional thatched roof above the surrounding cliffs supporting the temple’s millennium of history.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Enjoy a Morning Surf Lesson and Cultural Exploration
dayInfo.description: You will take to the sand to meet your private surf instructor as the tropical sun warms the beach. Your instructor will explain the dynamics of surfing before accompanying you into the warm water. You may feel the waves form beneath your fingertips as the water ebbs and flows beneath the board. After breakfast, you will make your way to Ubud. En route, you can stop in Tegenungan Village to visit with local farmers and children before walking the jungle trail. Tegenungan Waterfall will splash down into the waiting pool with cool waters that creates a refreshing mist.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Visit a Local Village, Coffee Plantation, and Iconic Rice Terraces
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture into the countryside to meet with villagers and traverse the variety of farms that thrive in the tropical climate. In the afternoon, you will reach a private plantation to learn the techniques and the importance of cultivating coffee in the region. The estate also produces vanilla, cinnamon, and chocolate. The steep slopes contain bushels of coffee plants with red berries. Your guide will offer you a sample of the coffee produced on the plantation and call your attention to the subtle aroma of caramel and a hint of chocolate that lingers on your palate.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Relish Sunrise at Mount Batur and Balinese Water Temples
dayInfo.description: Today you will wake before dawn and venture out into the jungle canopy revealing the lingering starlight. The dull moonlight may guide you up the plateau that overlooks the eastern edges of Mount Batur’s caldera. Sip a refreshing, hot cup of coffee and snack on a delicious banana as the sun begins to glow faintly across the horizon. You will go back down the slopes and continue to Tirta Empul temple, which was built in the 10th century. The grounds feature two pools and 30 showers fed by the natural mountain spring decorated with gilded dragonheads.

dayInfo.title: Gili Meno – Transfer to the Gili Islands
dayInfo.description: The scent of coconut and coffee may fill the morning air as you the Water Blow erupts like a volcano in the morning. Your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and lead you to the Gili Islands ferry. You will stop at Gili Meno and make your way to your gorgeous resort-style hotel. The remainder of the day is yours to discover island life. Horse-drawn carriages travel the trails as though you have stepped back in time. Mangrove trees dig their roots into the saltwater lake and palms rise above the canopy as egrets graze on the shore.

dayInfo.title: Gili Meno – Indulge in Gili Island Splendor and Enjoy a Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: The day will be yours to enjoy the Gili Islands at your preferred pace. Take to the waters on a snorkeling excursion or venture to Gili T and the summit of Treasure Hill. You could also wander the walkways of the Gili Meno Bird Park Resort in search of scarlet macaw. In the early morning hours, the Gili Komodo dragon emerges from its nest. You can take to the water to explore the fringing reefs in search of clownfish and wild green turtles before you visit a private kitchen with a celebrated chef to learn the art of Balinese cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Lombok – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the waves will lap against the white sand beaches and fishers may set out in their colorful boats in search of the perfect catch beyond the reef. At breakfast, you can sample the exotic flavors of a mangosteen and custard apples before making your way to the ferry bound for Lombok Island where your private transfer will greet you at the shore and escort you to the Lombok International Airport for your flight home.

placesVisited: Denpasar, Kuta, Sanur, Jimbaran, Ubud, Tanah Lot, Uluwatu, Batubalan, Kintamani, Seminyak, Legian
generalInfo: Bali is known as a destination that is shrouded in mythical stories and legends. The "Land of the Gods,” this is where folklore and legends come alive, as evident today as when they were first told. On this Bali vacation, see the Ramayana (a Hindu epic) before you are enamored by the fire dances and shadow plays; hear the tales of Bali’s royal past whispered from the spectacular temples, grand monuments, and ancient sacred sites. Be enchanted by its landscape; dine by the cliffs, by the sea and in the terraced rice fields. View the majestic volcano and its crater lake, coast along its cliffs and discover secluded bays. Then, traverse on its terraced rice fields, cross the sea with dolphins and catch the sunset. Your journey will leave you with memorable moments and smiles as Barong the mythical lion guards your door each night, and Garuda the mighty and mystical eagle protects you from above throughout your stay.

dayInfo.title: Sanur – Welcome to the Capital of Bali
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you at the airport in the bustling capital city of Denpasar. On your way to your luxury hotel, discover that the charms of Bali are also in its architecture as its myths and culture are carved on every street and every turn. Barong, the mythical lion, guards the land fiercely at the cities many entrances; statues of Arjuna, Hanuman , and other warriors stand tall in the city, perhaps still fighting the battle of good and evil, the eternal battle at that spun the beginning of Bali’s legends. Traditional architecture is also evident in your hotel, where you will certainly find rest. After a few moments to recover from your travels, visit the nearby Kuta and its famous Legian beach for a relaxing stroll to find a mélange of shops, cafes, and restaurants. Kuta has a mix of high-end brands and local wares, including the traditional kebayas (top), sarongs (wrap skirt), kamen (wrap for men) and udeng (headband for men). Renowned Balinese brands like Uluwatu and their handmade lace outfits and Bin House for batiks are also easily available. Over dinner, enjoy your first sunset in Bali before you return to your serene accommodations for a night of rest, lulled to sleep by the soft gamelan music that plays in the wind.

dayInfo.title: Sanur – Play with Dolphins at Dawn, then Up Close with Sharks and Turtles
dayInfo.description: Your day begins early and will be filled with magnificent marine life, and commences with a magical boat trip to watch the dolphins play at dawn. These gentle creatures are sure to thrill as they dance on the waves. Head towards the Serangan Island to get up close with young sharks at the sanctuary; swim with them in the water or simply get very close to learn more about the work done to help conserve these majestic predators. Your adventure will continue to the turtle sanctuary to see baby turtles hatching and the graceful adults keeping watch. Head back to Sanur for dinner by the beach, a perfect place to end the adventurous day. Paths are lined with Canang Sari (palm woven offerings filled with flowers and incense), candle lights and Balinese umbrellas while the breeze and waves serenade you and your loved one.

dayInfo.title: Sanur – Cook Up a Feast and then Pamper Yourself
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide will escort you to Denpasar and help you navigate through the local market to find fresh produce, spices, herbs and little snacks to try. Continue to the Balinese style kitchen and the chef will take you through a step by step guide to the art of preparing a local feast. Grind herbs and spices, mix a mélange of ingredients and cook the local way. And of course, sit down to enjoy the fruits of the labor amidst a Balinese styled home garden. Pamper yourself after your day’s work with a spa session. Indulge in traditional Balinese treatments where age-old techniques combine with jamu (natural products) for a relaxing treatment. Try the hair cream bath; a head, neck and shoulder massage of natural hair mask made of avocado, massaged onto the scalp and hair. Relax further with a traditional session of massage to melt away any tension in the body. Have a Mandi Lulur, a long held beauty ritual where turmeric, oils, rice flour and herbs are used as a body scrub to exfoliate, hydrate and relaxes. Follow it all with a bath in water scented with lime, flowers, and leaves, and all your cares will simply melt away.

dayInfo.title: Sanur – Discover Villiage Life and then Enjoy Art and Culture by Sunset
dayInfo.description: It is the care to detail and patience that transform the ordinary into something Balinese. Venture out to visit the batik making factory where you will be able to see and try this intricate art of drawing, waxing and dyeing delicate designs onto fabric. Be drawn into the little details that create this exquisite style of art before moving on to a further study of the architecture. Your guide will take you into the countryside to discover more and begins with the 17th-century Taman Ayun Temple. The temple sits on a landscaped garden of candi (stupas), pavilions, frangipanis and the surrounding lake. A beautiful backdrop for picturesque photos, journey further in to discover the Mengwi Village for a glimpse of country life before you arrive at the sacred monkey forest of Alas Kedaton. The serenity of the sacred ground is such that it even rubs off on the monkeys; find them calm and friendly, living peacefully and openly within a caste system, classified by power and perhaps resources. Ask your guide to point out the chiefs; you will know them as they have a banana or two stashed away. As the evening unfolds, arrive at the legendary Tanah Lot Temple, a revered icon set atop a rock out in the sea. During low tide, watch as ceremonial parades wind their way to the temple with garlands and offerings. At high tide, it is a marvel as waves crash and at sunset, the temple, and its grounds take on a mysterious glow. On certain days, catch the Hindu epic, the Ramayana, told through dance, songs and shadow play as the fire dances throughout the theatrical drama in the temple ground.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Explore the Uluwatu Temple and View the Magnificent Cliffs and Secluded Bays
dayInfo.description: Wake up and begin your day with a journey to Bali’s idyllic Jimbaran. Traverse along the idyllic coastline to find amazing views on top of cliffs and hide within the secluded bays. Pockets of near perfect beaches await; the Tegal Wangi, Pandawa, Padang Padang, Balangan, Bingin, and Dreamland are tucked away for your enjoyment along the coast. Pockets of heaven on earth for surfers and families alike, relax in the waters and the sand. When you are ready for a break from the streaming sun, continue to Uluwatu Temple for a quiet and scenic visit. Perched on a cliff, the temple makes for panoramic photos and if serendipity permits, catch the Kecak dance here as the Ramayana comes alive on this sacred spot in Jimbaran. Jimbaran is also the perfect place to enjoy a seafood feast, as the fishing village lies not far away and supplies the many restaurants with the freshest catch. Feast by the sea with your feet on the sandy bays, as the shores are lined with colorful parasols and candlelights against the backdrop of the sunset.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Adventure On the Water with Snorkeling by Day, Sunset by Night
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a day of adventure on the sea with an array of watersports available at your leisure. Venture out on a banana boat or enjoy an adrenaline adventure with jet skis, parasailing or fly fish sailing. Snorkel by the bay or sail away on a glass bottom boat as the opportunities abound. Bring a perfect balance to your adventurous day and wind down in Seminyak’s many luxurious lounges by the beach. Enjoy your drinks and lounge by the beachfront lawn and pool. For those who prefer a view from the top, dance all night on a restaurant perched on a cliff with a spectacular view from the terraced balcony and pool.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Journey through the Rice Fields in Search of Art, Crafts, and The Medicine Man
dayInfo.description: Ubud is famous for its unique mix of arts, spirituality, and scenic beauty. Enjoy the atmosphere where the mood and landscape, is an inspiration for filmmakers, artists and conservationists alike. There’s a lot to do in Ubud. Start your day at the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary as monkeys laze around in the sacred grounds of paths and steps that take you through nature’s greenery; the natural ponds mix with the man-made architecture of candi (stupas), pavilions, intricate statues, and carvings. Move on and visit the fortune teller and medicine man Ketut Liyer, famous for his role as himself in the movie Eat, Pray, Love . Ketut Liyer’s knowledge of divinity and medicine has been passed down to him from generation to generation, and many come to him just for his widely loved toothless grin and warm smile. Stop for lunch at any of the many restaurants with a scenic view of the rice fields and be served the traditional Bebek Betutu , a celebrated dish that consists of grilled duck with a variety of herbs, spices served with rice, side dishes and sambals (spicy sauces). Next, take a walk in the Art Market for some more handicrafts, trinkets, and souvenirs. Stroll through the streets to discover gem making, arts, and handmade crafts. Visit the nearby water palace Puri Saren Agung where kings lived until the 1940s, and just before dusk, catch the fleet of herons as they return en mass to the village of Petulu. End the bright day of exploration with a quiet dinner by the river; a perfect evening with your loved one in the town that inspires artists.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Travel from the Holy Springs to the Hills to View the Majestic Volcano of Mount Batur
dayInfo.description: From Ubud, travel next into the countryside to learn more about Bali’s intertwined culture and natural landscape. The Balinese believe that the island is the Land of Gods, where Dewas (deities in Balinese Hinduism) shift mountains and serpents arise from the sea to guard its sacred grounds. Journey into the mythical nature of Bali as the day begins with a trip to Batubalan to witness the Barong and the Keris. These traditional dances retell the Ramayana , the Hindu epic, the source of Bali’s beginning. Silver, gold, and wood are honored and used to carve Bali’s legends and folklores. Head into the artisan village of Celuk, where silver and gold are melted and formed into collectible pieces, then proceed to Mas, the wood carving center of all the artisan villages in Ubud. Travel along the scenic terraced rice fields and stop for lunch against the beautiful landscape. Enjoy the other notable Balinese dish, the Babi Guling (roasted suckling pig) or the staple dish of Nasi Campur (rice with a variety of dishes). The Tegal Lalang is one of the most magnificent terraced rice fields and is yours to explore via walking tour. Journey further into the holy spring of Gunung Kawi temple in Sebatu, a serene sanctuary where the holy spring is surrounded by mythical shrines and grand statues. This is where the royals once frolicked, and you see the royal monuments and delicate courtesans that are dedicated to Bali’s kings and dewas (deities). Many locals come to seek ablution and healing with the holy water, especially on days of full moons. As the day continues, travel into the village of Kintamani to view the majestic Mount Batur, an active volcano, and its crater lake, said to be built by a friendly giant. Clouds often encircle the mountain, and the glistening lake whispers to its mystical past. Before sundown, return to the traditional village of Panglipuran in the foothills for an idyllic end to the day.

dayInfo.title: Seminyak – Traverse the Coastline from the Hills to the Sea
dayInfo.description: Wake up to a nurturing breakfast before you are driven to Seminyak for a relaxing day by the waves to be spent at your leisure. Stroll from Seminyak to Legian Beach, and end the day watching the sunset amongst the many beachfront cafes and restaurants. Let the many bands along the beachfront serenade you as you sink into your seat on the sandy beach. Dine and wine with your loved one as the sun, large and bright, begins its descent into the sea horizon.

dayInfo.title: Seminyak – Farewell to Bali
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the gamelan music and the sounds of birds chirping in the distance, as the coffee brews in the background and breakfast await. A lovely journey has been had, and your beautiful memories are packed to be brought home along with Bali’s many folklores and legends. Your private transfer will bring you to Ngurah Rai Airport, and as you approach, see the warrior Arjuna and Hanuman looking down to bid you farewell and a safe return.

tourName: Vacation to Bali with the Family
generalInfo: Discover the fascinating wonders of jungle highlands, verdant rice fields, and captivating white-sand beaches during your customized family-friendly Bali tour. The kids find enchantment inside temples guarded by troupes of rambunctious monkeys. You can relax in the Indian Ocean searching for clownfish along the reef glowing with sea anemones. The entire family will be captivated by the stories and antics of Rahwana, the Demon King. From chocolate plantations to surf lessons, cliff top temples to gorgeous panoramas, Bali offers a new world of captivating culture, fascinating artwork, fabulous cuisine, and charming scenery the entire family will enjoy. Enjoy a Bali family vacation in style by seeing the other Bali family vacation packages we offer on Zicasso.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Arrive in Bali and Enjoy the Day at Leisure in Bali’s Cultural Center
dayInfo.description: Ubud is the center of Bali’s preserved culture inside an enchanting town decorated with terraced rice paddies, classical dancers, and prolific artwork all telling the heritage and history of the Indonesian island. Your flight lands at Ngurah Rai International Airport, where your private transfer greets the family upon arrival. You travel into the hills to reach the stunning ambiance of Ubud noticing the collection of quiet cafes, relaxed restaurants, and bustling boutique shops where local artists display their wares. The kids quickly and eagerly conform to the atmosphere of serene creativity set among the verdant trees and lush hills. Before sunset, the family visits the nearby village of Petulu to view the herons. The whole family marvels at their elegance as the scattering returns accentuated by brilliant layers of orange, red, and yellow of the Balinese sunset.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – View a Barong and Kris Dance Followed by a Cycling Excursion
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the lotus blossoms bloom on the waters in front of Pura Taman Saraswati Temple. The sunlight spreads across the captivating carvings depicting Dewi Saraswati, the goddess of wisdom and patron of the arts. Each night the courtyard brims with activity as dancers showcase the ways in which the goddess has blessed Ubud with an abundance of artistry. After breakfast, the family experiences how Bali breathes life into their legends during the Barong and Kirs dance. The performance portrays the epic spiritual battle of good versus evil in the form of the prominent King of Spirts, Barong, who is depicted as a lion opposing the Queen of Demons, Rahwana, who leads an army of witches. The storytelling captivates you and the children, who eagerly wait to celebrate the victor. After the performance, you hop on bicycles and take to the country roads in and around Ubud stopping at the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary. The grey long-tailed macaques are considered sacred in Balinese culture roaming the forest freely amid the 27 acres hosting approximately 115 different types of tree. The canopy hides the eclectic collection of temples scattered around the protected forest. You venture deeper into the forest and find the 14th century Pura Dalem Agung Padangtegal temple. Moss grows slick on the stones of the ancient relics and statues with the fading light adding to the mysterious ambiance of the complex near the protruding roots of the banyan tree.

dayInfo.title: Ubud – Visit a Local Village for a Traditional Farming Experience
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the kids enjoy the variety of sweet and colorful fruits like jackfruit, guava, dragon fruit, or rambutan. You sip a delicious coffee made with beans sourced from the Balinese highlands. You travel to a small village on the outskirts of Ubud after the meal for insight into the daily life of farmers on the Indonesian archipelago. You begin in the village of Tunjuk located on the vast rice fields. Your instructor offers insight into the importance of rice and the harvest in Indonesian culture. The kids love wearing the traditional conical hat commonly used by farmers or locals Bali to protect their faces and necks from the sun. Spend time learning the intricate process of planting, transplanting, and harvesting the rice, as well as the ways in which a farmer must sow the land. Water buffalo help plow the lush landscape churning the soil. The tropical sun beats hot later in the day. The family rests with a refreshingly cool coconut. You continue to the Jatiluwih Rice Terraces with fresh eyes, knowing the amount of work necessary for not only erected the tiers along the sloped landscape but the persistence required in tilling, planting, and harvesting the rice. The views overlooking the Balinese countryside are breathtaking, encompassing the caldera of Kintamani and the peak of Mount Batur in the distance. You continue to a celebrated farm in the afternoon famous for growing and producing sensational chocolate. The kids are excited to hear they can sample as much chocolate as they want but immediately become confused when seeing the cocoa pods for the first time. The large, dense pods grow on trees and look like a squash instead of the chocolate bars or chips with which the kids are familiar. Your guide opens the pod revealing the cocoa beans beneath a white gelatinous coating with a sweet and tangy flavor. The beans must ferment for up to a week before they are ready for drying and roasting. After grinding, heating, and adding sugar to the beans, your guide has created a concoction similar to what the family knows as decadent chocolate.

dayInfo.title: Bali Barat – Travel to Bali Barat National Park Stopping Ulun Danu Bratan
dayInfo.description: The artists of Ubud return to the famous Art Market in the morning opening their shops to reveal the plethora of hand-carved statues, hand-woven garments, and sensational paintings embodying the spiritual essence of Balinese culture. Your private transfer greets the family in the hotel lobby before escorting you through the highlands to the remarkable temple of Pura Ulun Danu Bratan. The complex remains the dramatic icon of the island featuring the soaring tiered spire reflected in the stoic waters of Lake Bratan. The temple was erected in the 17th century and used for ceremonial offerings to Dewi Danu, the water goddess. The Meru Tower stands approximately 110 feet tall and is dedicated to Shiva, the principal Hindu deity. The picturesque view before reaching the island incorporates the thatched-roof of the multi-tiered shrines in the foreground with a backdrop of mist drifting across the mountains. Four gates on the temple island refer to the four directions and leading into the four groups of shrines comprising the entire temple complex.

dayInfo.title: Bali Barat – Relax at the Family’s Preferred Pace Discovering the Park
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you look out the window of your gorgeous hotel in Bali Barat National Park and notice the deer wandering alongside the shoreline of the island’s western edge. The national park encompasses the remoteness of the untamed jungle and the fascinating majesty of pristine gold-sand beaches. The family explores the walking trails leading into the forest providing fantastic views of the Bali Starling. Their white plumage and decorative black tips along the tail and wings stand out from the surrounding verdant trees. They can grow to nearly 10 inches in length using sharp chattering calls to communicate. Fewer than 100 adults currently live in the wild, but the local community has begun conservation efforts. You also look for the marbled cat during your time on the trails, eventually finding evidence of the feline’s presence in fresh footprints. The marbled cat is similar in size, body, and tail to a domestic cat with a thick coat and webbed paws. They can grow up to 24 inches long with a tail thick with fur.

dayInfo.title: Bali Barat – Adventure to Menjangan Island for a Fantastic Snorkeling Tour
dayInfo.description: The island of Pulau Menjangan sits off the coast of Bali Barat National Park acting as a beacon of untouched beauty within the greater protected land- and seascape of western Bali. The island encompasses 9,390 square feet of towering jungle and lush savannahs. The family ventures to the island for a day along the wild grounds and tremendous shores home to the rare Javan rusa deer. The deer graze on the grassland at the heart of Pulau Menjangan and can grow to over six feet tall weighing over 352 pounds. The untouched waters around the island provide clear conditions year-round for scuba divers and snorkelers. The family enjoys the hot, gold sand beneath their feet before wading into the warm refreshing waters of the Indian Ocean in search of the forest beneath the wake. The reef is quiet but bustling with vibrant hues. Angelfish wander around the kids curious as to what they’ve found floating in the water. The kids point to a clownfish sticking its small face outside of a glowing anemone. The clownfish grows over four inches long with three white lines crossing their torso against the bright orange body. They build their home in anemones, part of the coral reefs billowing like trees in a strong wind due to the movement of the current. Olive ridley sea turtles also frequently visit the coral reef when searching for food or swimming near the nest from which they were birthed.

dayInfo.title: Munduk – Venture to the Fabulous Balinese Highlands for Wonderful Views
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, the coastal scenery of Bali Barat National Park fades away replaced by the climbing mountains and lush forests of Bali’s lesser-explored highlands. The climate cools to a consistent 72 degrees Fahrenheit. The scenic drive takes you along twists and turns filled with the sweet aromas of blossoming frangipani and orchids. The town of Munduk is located between 2,624 and 2,952 feet above sea level surrounded by epic jungle, hidden waterfalls, and plantations cultivating chocolate and cocoa. Before reaching Munduk, you stop at the stone sarcophagus of Pura Duur. The stone was uncovered in the 19th century as a relic once broken into six pieces. Greater archeological evidence from the region suggests a thriving community existed in the region between the 10th and 14th centuries long before the arrival of the Dutch in the 19th century who experimented with growing commercial crops. You stop once more at Twin Lake for the fascinating view overlooking the glossy waters below. Small cafes line the precipice along the ridge leading to Munduk with each establishment offering a unique draw beyond the stunning panorama including a swing allowing you and the kids to feel like you’re dangling above the waters of Lake Buyan and Lake Tamblingan.

dayInfo.title: Munduk – Explore the Local Plantations and Scenery with a Bike Ride Tour
dayInfo.description: Instead of having your morning coffee accompanied by the floral aromas of hyacinth inside the hotel dining room, the family mounts their bicycles and ventures to a local coffee plantation for a deeper insight into ways locals have taken to cultivating the beans in the highlands. The landscape around the Bali mountains provides the proper climate for producing coffee beans, which utilize the cool temperatures, morning mists, and plentiful rainfall. Coffee connoisseurs agree the plantations from Munduk produce some of the best coffee on the entire island. Your guide introduces the family to the coffee plant, which is a member of the jasmine family. The kids pick flowers off the growing stocks and inhale the sweet, rich fragrance. The organic coffee producer works hard to combat the environmental effects of farming including soil erosion and falling water tables helping the surrounding forest to regrow, which in turn provides sustainable coffee production and a more intense flavor to the growing beans. When looking at the plant, you expect to find a grain or seed but instead notice the bright cherries dangling from the coffee tree. After learning how workers pick the beans by hand, you find the decadent aroma of roasting beans emanating from the tasting area. Your guide pours the family different styles of cups allowing you to sample the different tastes the variety of beans produce.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Transfer to Jimbaran for Uluwatu Temple and the Kecak Dance
dayInfo.description: The family travels back down the mountains from the rim of the caldera and away from the Twin Lakes. The scenery shifts from the stunning jungle colored with orchids to open villages and rice fields. The scent of hyacinths fills the air giving way to the salty aroma of the sea air at Jimbaran Beach. The white sand along the shoreline glows against the azure waters of the Indian Ocean. Food stalls populate the esplanade leading to the rocky headland. The relaxed environment welcomes the family to the famous southern coastline of Bali accentuated by the sensational local market offering glimpses into daily life. Before sunset, the family visits the nearby Uluwatu Temple, which is perched on a cliff. The fascinating setting reveals a dramatic background of the watery horizon with the traditional Balinese architecture of the gateways, spires, and decorative sculptures in the foreground. Locals believe the monkeys living in the small neighboring forest protect the temple from evil spirits. The temple complex embodies the point at which the powers of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva meet. The kids point out the flower carvings and leaves decorating the split entry gates guarded by sculptures of human bodies crowned with elephant heads. After visiting the temple, you continue to Kecak Fire Dance. The iconic Balinese performance immerses the family in folklore once more, this time telling the epic drama of how the demon Rahwana stole Sita from her husband. The incredible narrative comes to life with the rise and fall of humming from upwards of 75 performers emphasizing the power and harmony the legend continues to bring to listeners.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Delight in a Family-Friendly Surf Lesson and Pottery Class
dayInfo.description: The kids return to the options of delicious fruit at the breakfast table indulging in the sweet and satisfying tastes of the local, seasonal bananas, rambutans, and guavas not available back home. You venture to the beach after the meal to meet your private surfing instructor. The white sand is hot beneath your feet. The wetsuit has a tight, rubbery texture on your skin. The sound of the waves and light sea breeze reminds you of where you are as your instructor gives you the basics of surfing. You start with the sand on the board learning to stand up comfortably without the balance issue caused by the water. When you feel comfortable, your instructor guides you through the water away from the shoreline where the waves form. He holds the board in place and gives you an extra push as the wave takes shape pushing the board forward. You paddle with the current. As the wave breaks, you push up feeling the splash around you. In the afternoon, the family continues uncovering the traditions of Bali with a pottery lesson. The culture of ceramics has deep roots on the island displayed in local homes, boutique shops, and the local ceramics museum in South Bali. Your instructor leads you through the basic techniques of forming, wedging, and centering with local artisans crafting animals, pots, kitchenware, and cutlery.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Indulge in a Fantastic Cooking Class and Relaxing Afternoon
dayInfo.description: The promised aroma of traditional Balinese cuisine brings the family to a morning market under the wing of a celebrated Balinese chef. The produce glows with stunning natural colors reflecting the ripeness, freshness, and quality of the locally harvested fruits and vegetables. The chef shows you the source of her delicious meals as you wander through the aisles of the marketplace noticing the radiant chilis and gigantic cassavas. Once in the kitchen, the aromas of peanut sauce drift through the air. Your chef explains the ways the family can easily make classic Balinese cuisine with simple ingredients, from grilling chicken skewers to steaming vegetables. The kids enjoy helping in the kitchen finding ways to add their flourish to the classic dishes before you’ve created a stunning fried rice known as Nasi Goreng accompanied by a sweet drink of green jelly with coconut and palm sugar.

dayInfo.title: Jimbaran – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The Kedonganan Fish Market brims with activity in the morning after the fishermen return to shore with their fresh catches of the day. The fish market represents the largest seafood marketplace on Bali hosting saltwater catches like red snapper and prawns, as well as the rare mahi-mahi. Seafood cafes abound with locals cooking their own catch, purchasing seafood from the local purveyors, or providing delicious recipes to visitors who bring their own chosen seafood in from the vendors in the market. Your private transfer greets the family in the hotel lobby after breakfast, and you pass the bustling aisles of the market on your way to Ngurah Rai International Airport, where the family boards your flight home.
